abstract: As production resumes this week in Georgetown, Ky., and other American cities where Toyota builds cars, people are eager to see its recall problems blow over.
snippet: As production resumes this week in Georgetown, Ky., and other American cities where Toyota builds cars, people are eager to see its recall problems blow over.
lead_paragraph: GEORGETOWN, Ky.  Before Toyota arrived here more than two decades ago, Georgetown was a sleepy town of 10,000. Its population has since swelled to 25,000, and most of those people owe their livelihood to the sprawling Toyota plant outside of town on Cherry Blossom Way.

headline.main: Optimism Persists in a Kentucky Town Where a Carmaker Brought Jobs
headline.print_headline: Looking With Anxiety at Toyota’s Future, From Two Perspectives

abstract: Wheels: Toyota dealers in five states pull ads from ABC.
snippet: Wheels: Toyota dealers in five states pull ads from ABC.
lead_paragraph: Our sister blog, Wheels, has a piece up about how Toyota dealers in five Southern states – Alabama, Florida, Georgia and both Carolinas – have pulled their ads from ABC because they are upset with the coverage the network has given to the auto company’s recent recall woes. Brian Ross, ABC’s chief investigative reporter, says ABC is not letting the protest divert them from covering the story. Read more here.

headline.main: Wheels: Toyota Dealers in Five States Pull Ads from ABC
